text.p: These are the leading stories in the Moroccan press on Sunday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- Referendum on constitutional reforms: 10.16 million Moroccans voted "yes" or 99.56 percent of votes.
- Congo cuts ties with self-styled Saharan Arab Democratic Republic. Congo's premier to visit Morocco on Monday.
- As expected, a massive participation to the referendum on constitutional amendments took place on Friday.
- Moroccan political leaders unanimous on "yes" vote on Friday and its positive effect on Morocco's political future.
- Moroccan people approved at 99.56 percent the new draft constitution.
- Interior Minister told French media self-determination referendum in the disputed Western Sahara cannot be avoided.
- Morocco confirms indirectly a meeting with leaders of Polisario guerrillas leaders. Rabat reiterates its committment to U.N. peace plan in Western Sahara.
- King Hassan confers with Equatorial Guinea President who is on private visit to Morocco.
